generalInfo:
Explore the Best of Nepal, Bhutan, and Tibet: A 15-Day Adventure

Embark on one of our favorite tours, perfect for those eager to experience the highlights of Nepal, Bhutan, and Tibet in just 15 days. This carefully curated package offers charming views of the Himalayas, vibrant cultures, UNESCO World Heritage sites, ancient temples and monasteries, and the indomitable spirit of mountain communities.

The adventure begins with a tour of the Kathmandu Valley, immersing you in its rich history and vibrant culture. Next, we journey to the incredibly scenic Nagarkot, where you can marvel at the sight of Mt. Everest and enjoy a glorious sunrise. Did you know Nepal is home to stunning rice terraces perched on hillsides, adorned with picturesque villages? You'll experience this firsthand with day hikes that offer a glimpse into the daily lives of local people, providing opportunities for genuine interaction.

Our journey continues to the enchanting Balthali and Dhulikhel, where you will visit beautiful monasteries and soak in the serene landscapes.

In Bhutan, no tour is complete without a hike to the iconic Tiger's Nest Monastery. You'll explore the best this kingdom has to offer, including breathtaking valleys, imposing fortresses, ancient monasteries, and fascinating museums.

The Tibet segment of the tour offers a deep cultural immersion, beginning with an extensive exploration of Lhasa. You'll witness the stunning views of Yamdrok-Tso Lake and gain insight into the profound spirituality and traditions of Tibetan culture.

Throughout the tour, you'll travel in the comfort of a private vehicle with experienced local guides who will enrich your journey with detailed explanations of our diverse cultures.

Join us for this unforgettable 15-day tour and experience the very best of Nepal, Bhutan, and Tibet. Book now and create memories that will last a lifetime.

dayInfo.description: Arrival to Kathmandu: our representative will meet and greet you at the airport to escort you to your hotel. The activities will depend on the time of your arrival. We’ll visit Pashupatinath Temple, the holiest place for Hindu people. Meals: -

Nagarkot: in the morning after breakfast, we’ll take a scenic drive to Nagarkot via Bhaktapur Durbar Square, a city of devotees, and Changu Narayan, the oldest temple of Nepal. The rest of the day is free for relaxing and enjoying mountain views. Meals: breakfast

Dhulikhel: after glorious sunrise over the Himalayas and rice terraces, we’ll have our breakfast and move towards Dhulikhel. We’ll stop in Panauti and Banepa, an ancient town for sightseeing and some street strolling. In the afternoon check in to the hotel and have a rest enjoying the countryside views. Meals: breakfast

Balthali Village: after breakfast, we’ll take a short hike for approximately 2 hrs to explore rice terraces and some local villages around. After that, we drive to Balthali village where you can enjoy the Himalayan views, experience customs and traditions, also savour authentic Newari cuisine. Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

Return to Kathmandu: after breakfast, we’ll start our scenic drive through picturesque villages and see the highest point of Kathmandu. On a clear day mount Everest can be seen. We will visit significant Pashupatinath Temple and Bouddanath temple to learn about spirituality in Buddhism and Hinduism. Meals: breakfast

Fly to Bhutan: according to your flights, we’ll take you to the airport to catch your flight to Bhutan. Upon arrival, drive to the capital city Thimphu, check into hotel and visit Memorial Stupa built-in 1974 in the memory of Bhutan‘s third King, His Late Majesty, King Jigme Dorji Wangchuk. Buddha Point which is 169 feet tall and it’s the best place for photographers. Next visit Simply Museum provides a glimpse into the traditional Bhutanese life. The artefacts which are kept inside the house remind the visitors about how the rural Bhutanese live today. Later visit Trashi chhodzong fortress of the glorious religion Tashichhodzong houses some ministries, His Majesty’s secretariat, and the central monk body. Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

Punakha: today after breakfast you will drive to Punakha (1300m/4265ft) the former capital of Bhutan. On the way after 45 minutes’ drive from Thimphu will reach at highest pass between Thimphu and Punakha the place called Dochula pass (3140m) where you can have a superb view of the Eastern Himalayas on a clear day. Proceed to Chhimi Lhakhang a temple dedicated to the Devine Madman and a sacred place where people pray for children. Upon arrival check-in hotel and visit Punakha Dzong a very beautiful Bhutanese architecture armed by the Pho Chu (Male River). Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

Paro: after early breakfast drive back to Paro, check-in hotel. Visit National Museum and Ringpung Dzong, Visit Kichu Lakhang and in the evening stroll around Main Street for some interesting Himalayan artefacts or textiles or have a relaxing stay in the hotel. Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

Tiger’s Nest (3-4hours round walk trip): this morning you will hike to Taktshang, Tiger’s Nest. It is located atop at 2800 meter cliff in Paro. Taktshang or the Tigers lair as the monastery is widely regarded is one of the most important in Bhutan. After that we will visit local farm to relax and unwind. Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner

Fly to Kathmandu: according to your flight time, you’ll be taken to the airport to catch your flight to Kathmandu. In the afternoon we’ll go for sightseeing: Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), Patan Durbar Square and Kathmandu Durbar Square. Meals: breakfast

Fly to Lhasa: depending on your flight time you will be transferred to the airport by our representative. Upon arrival in Lhasa, the rest of the day is free for you to explore the local area and acclimate yourself to the high altitude and weather of Lhasa. In the evening we will brief about the next few days over dinner. Meals: breakfast

Potala Palace: in the morning, the overwhelming Potala Palace is your first stop. As the symbol of Tibet, it was built in 641 AD and was the winter palace of Dalai Lama who is Tibet’s pope. Impressive Tibetan architecture, huge golden Buddha statues, red-robed lamas and devoted pilgrims all make it a must-visit. In the afternoon, you’ll visit the Jokhang Temple, the spiritual centre of Tibet. Every day, pilgrims from every corner of Tibet trek here from long distances to worship. Finally, walk the special circular pilgrimage route as local followers always do at Barkhor Street where you can buy Tibetan traditional or religious things as a souvenir. Meals: breakfast

Shigatse: in the morning, drive from Lhasa to Shigatse. On the way, drive over the Gampala pass (4790 m), and you will have a glimpse of Yamdrok-Tso (4400m). The Lake is surrounded by many snow-capped mountains and in the distance, you can have spectacular views of Holy Mount Nyenchen Khangsar, (7191m) the highest mountain near Lhasa. Later, we will pass and enjoy the Korola Glacier on the roadside; At Manak Dam Lake, you can hang pray flag at Simila Mountain Pass. Then, we will arrive in Gyantse, historically Tibet's third-largest city (after Lhasa and Shigatse).In Gyantse, we will visit the famous Pelkor Monastery and Gyantse Kumbum and enjoy the Far view of Gyangtse Fortress. After one and a half driving, we arrive in Shigatse, which is the second-largest city in Tibet. In Shigatse, we may visit traditional Barley Mill and view the landscape of Barley Field (in summer). Meals: breakfast

Lhasa: in the morning, we will visit the home of Panchan Lama - Tashilunpo Monastery; you can see the well preserved largest statue of Jampa (future god) in the world. The monastery itself is abiding place for the successive Penchen Lamas. Then we are expected to follow Yalong Valley back to Lhasa, and the guide will get you transferred to your hotels. Meals: breakfast

Flight to Kathmandu: after breakfast, you’ll be transferred to the airport for your flight to Kathmandu. Check-in time 2 hours prior departure. Upon arrival you'll be taken to the hotel and the rest of the day is your free time to explore Kathmandu and do some shopping. Meals: breakfast
Departure: we will make sure that you are on time for your return flight home. Check in is 3 hours prior departure. Say "Namaste" and until next time! Meals: breakfast
